text: [MUSIC PLAYING]

Imagine that we're
no longer in Klarman.

Instead, imagine that you're
sitting in a bare brick house
in the middle of the tropics.

There's a hole in
the roof and there's

a slight odor in the air
because the bathroom is leaking.

This is the type of house
that many Indonesians live in.

In fact, 80% of
Indonesians live in houses

that they have built
themselves because buying

from a real estate
developer is too expensive

and getting a mortgage
is almost impossible.

I lived in one of these houses
when I was in Indonesia,

and saw firsthand how poor
living conditions lead

to lower quality of life,
lower productivity, and fewer

economic opportunities
for generations to come.
Pando is here to change that.

We give affordable
home improvement loans

to the under-banked
communities so

that they can
transform their lives
by transforming their homes.

We target middle-income
blue collar workers

by partnering with
employers to give

Pando loans to their employees
as an employee benefit.

Repayment is made via
direct payroll deduction,

which greatly improves
our chance of repayment.

Since launching last
year, we've disbursed

over 100 loans with zero
default rates so far,

and have 1,000 people
on our wait-list.

Pando is here to
transform lives.

Home improvement loans
is the first step.

We plan to grow
with our customers

as they build their
credibility to give them

more credit and
financial management
products in the future.

My name is Claire Wu, and I'm
the founder and CEO of Pando.

Join us as we democratize
credit to transform lives.
[CHEERING AND APPLAUSE]
